text: ANGLE: straight down and moving. An infinite patchwork of blasted cityscape in cubes and rectangles.

All you can do when it comes to the people you love is brace yourself. (beat) That's just how it is. The tops of buildings from way far up. Rolling out before like a gargantuan concrete blanket spattered in greenery.

ANGLE: we come in on a set of youthful shoulders. A KID, seated, facing away from us. Beyond, behind a desk, is an AGING WOMAN, dressed in conservative attire. This boy is ELI (12), black, handsome. Quiet.
How would you say the year has been, overall? Still facing away from us, Eli shrugs.
Good? Bad?
Normal. I think.
Normal for you, or for a regular school year?
For a school year.
How was your year? Eli is quiet for a moment. Doesn’t answer that question. as he holds this silence -- we BEGIN TO TRACK around him
Fine. The Guidance Counselor doesn’t push any harder on this.
And things at home? How’s your dad? How’s he doing? Another shrug.

What about plans for the summer, any vacations in the works? Eli shakes his head. And now we’ve gotten our first good at him. Handsome for sure. Wise-beyond-his-years... ... the Guidance Counselor takes in his face and smiles, pleasant. But there’s something preoccupied lingering.

It’s okay to talk to me, Elijah. (beat) It is. Sitting across from me I see a young man who’s creative, and smart -- (then) -- but who doesn’t want to be seen. The Guidance Counselor waits another beat for Eli to take this in. When he stays quiet, she lets him go --
Be good out there. We’ll see you in September.
Okay. And over this -- we HEAR THE SOUND OF A SCHOOL BELL -- th FERVOR of EXCITED STUDENT VOICES transitioning us into -- EXT. ST. FLORIAN’S - PARKING LOT - DAY

ON ELI as he moves. Apart from his CLASSMATES, celebratin and WHOOPING as the school year ends -- SOME race for BASKETBALL COURTS, GIRLS Eli’s age flutter and out of GOSSIPY CIRCLES, OTHER KIDS opt for TRICKS on SKATEBOARDS -- CUTTING past Eli -- who moves on his own. Wading through all this. We see it clear as day. Eli doe gel with his peers. He’s not one of them. Setting out ins for the neighborhoods beyond. Determined.
A rusty garage door is YANKED open. Eli, with a backpack his shoulder, enters and crosses for -- -- a weathered BMX bike.

PEDALING. Sunshine. Wanderlust. Spokes WHIP past, as does -- hodge-podge of low-rent signage in this heart of DETRO former industrial corridor. Polish, Bangladeshi, Arabic a more. Eli WEAVES westward up Caniff -- skids to a STOP at
HASAN, a tattooed Arabic teen with a cigarette lit, sees coming, sweeping out front --
You got another haul for us or what?
Almost there. What’s copper at?
Copper and aluminum radiators. Seventy cents a pound this week.
(re: up the street) L & J says they’1l do 80. Hasan looks at Eli. Beat. Then drags and smiles.
That's what they said? (Eli nods) I'll talk to my uncle. Bring what you got here first, okay? (in Arabic) Little thief.

Eli makes his way across the 1-75 OVERPASS now. Into wide swaths of DERELICT CITY which follow. Open expanses of VA LOTS, ABANDONED HOMES and FACTORIES. Remnants of a differ era. Epic. Dystopic. Eli a SPECK in this wild.

Interconnected shells of buildings TOWER past barb-wire g Abandoned. Busted glass, scorched pavement and litter. Eli SWOOPS PAST into view, stashes his bike near an overp peels back a section of perimeter fencing --

Almost cathedral-like. Eli enters. Ahead, a wide section the roof has collapsed under decades of heavy snow. Vines and greenery swallow fossilized machinery guts now the hot and humid months. Dancing across ruin.

ECHOES. Eli uses a CROWBAR from his bag to CHIP away at walls. He slows -- peers into the hole he’s just burrowed He knew it. Begins TUGGING out dirty COPPER WIRE. Begins excavating ALUMINUM PIPING next. Piece by piece. An exper ANGLES: stuffing his backpack. Searching. Hacking. REPEAT the process. AGAIN. AGAIN. AGAIN. His haul growing...

SHIMMYING beneath a half-collapsed door. Further inside n Eli sets his nearly-full backpack down for a beat -- -- and reaches into his pocket to grab an INHALER. A PUFF we recognize as the type carried for asthma. Eli uses it. Takes a deep BREATH reaches for his CROWBAR -- Then stops. Beat. His breath is visible. It's cold in her Eli turns. Spots a DARKENED CORRIDOR ahead. A small froze wind brushes past. Eli removes a MAGLIGHT from his backpa

MOVING through total blackness. Eli clicks on the flashli as -- KKAA-RRUUNG. A NOISE faraway -- dust shakes loose a -- Eli LOOKS. Listens a beat. Nothing follows. His breath FOGGING the air thicker. It’s summer outside. should be an oven in here. Eli shines his light -- crystalline formations of ice are visible along the floor at his feet and along walls. He m around a final bend, frost crunching underfoot, into --

A MASSIVE DERELICT CHAMBER. Enters. Cautious -- Eli sees something that takes him -- and us -- a moment t process. This cavernous space like all the others except: Whispers of light snow levitate past -- Adding an ethereal aura to what looks like DAMAGE done by some kind of WEAPONS FIRE. Slits of natural light cut thr BLAST HOLES EVERYWHERE. Not done by bullets. Something else. Eli, heart beginning to thunder -- steps forward. And see BODIES. A half-odd dozen of them or more -- All in ADVANCED, MENACING, OTHERWORLDLY ARMOR -- lying st about the space in varying configurations of carnage. Eli has somehow wandered into the aftermath of an O.K. Co scenario. Only we can’t be sure the players are from Eart HOLY. FUCKING. SHIT. This was an ugly fight too. Eli turns. Half expecting sir or some adult to burst into the room and take charge... Only silence and frozen wind call back. Eli hesitates. Wa even closer... ..-- from the look of these ARMORED BODIES, there were TW DISTINCT SIDES. ONE has sleeker-looking ARMOR, the SECOND rough-etched. Utilitarian beneath bits of battered garb. Both sides WEAR MECHANIZED HELMETS. Concealing their feat Eli sloooowly approaches the closest MOTIONLESS BODY, sp out across a pile of RUBBLE -- he stares at the helmet an carefully wipes away a thin layer of frost from the visor -- and slows. At Eli’s feet: IS SOME KIND OF METALLIC DEV One of theirs. Its contours sleek and other-worldly. Eli leans down... grips it. Cautious. Lifts it to INSPECT -- -- and the gesture ACTIVATES something. The device CHIMES Some kind of PROMPT, as though it’s POWERING UP. As it do -- the device OPENS. Or rather, the OUTER LAYER DOES. A s retracting SHIELD. Revealing the CONTOURS of what’s clear SHOTGUN-SIZED ALIEN WEAPON beneath -- -- then the MOTIONLESS BODY he was just examining MOVES. helmet turns, looks right at Eli -- -- and the ARMORED FIGURE THRUSTS A DYING HAND TOWARDS EL Eli RECOILS. SLIPS on ice. FALLS. DROPS everything -- MAGLIGHT gone. THE WEAPON-SHAPED DEVICE TOO. It goes SLID away from Eli and -- DOWN INTO an open ELEVATOR SHAFT --
Eli SCRAMBLES. Slip-sliding. FUMBLES for his BACKPACK.

PIECES of piping clang and roll down the street as Eli PE away. Backpack not zipped up. RACING like FUCKING HELL -- PANTING. HYPERVENTILATING. PANIC. EYES WIDE -- only once cleared a good few blocks does Eli skid to a stop -- GASPING. Sheer. Utter. Absolute. Disbelief. He reaches on more for his INHALER, and as he does, USES it -- BREATHES Staring back at the ABANDONED COMPLEX -- we CUT TO:
Eli pedals, ghostly pale, scanning every passing face. Fo concerned with daily commutes, deliveries -- the mundane.
Eli ushers his BMX up the drive of a tiny, sturdy home. B originally for auto-workers in the 1920s. Stashes his bik
And moves for the back of the garage to an overturned WHE BARROW. Lifts it to reveal a BOX FILLED with SCRAP metal. deposits what’s left in his backpack and --

Eli. Quiet. Motionless. Mind still churning. Replaying ev in his head atop a sofa in this working man's living room HEADLIGHTS of an early nineties PICKUP TRUCK pull into th driveway outside. Booted FOOTSTEPS approach -- HAROLD HROBSKY, or HAL (late 50s), white, enters. A batte old Polack. Face and hands like granite. Hard lines. Wear a well-used Red Wings jacket.
Finish your homework?
Summer break started.
(recollects, looks around) And now you've, what? Forgotten how to read? Hal points to a NOTE. Hand-scrawled in bossy all-caps: DO
Get your shoes on, I need help with something.
Eli straining, helping Hal move a shitload of cut lumber his truck to the garage in the dark. This sucks.
-- that rush gig in Corktown. They change their minds every day last minute, had to -- pick all this up for tomorrow --  They set down the last piece. Eli realizes --
We gotta load all this back in?
At six thirty a.m. That is correct. (off Eli’s look) Somebody’'11 steal it. Hal passes en route for the garage. Eli silently protesti
Who’s gonna steal a buncha wood?
(sends him a look) You seen my maglight? That would be the flashlight Eli abandoned earlier. Oops.

Not lately... Hal CURSES in Polish, scans the place one more time in ve and crosses back to the truck for invoice slips. Sits on the lift-gate. Squints and scribbles. Eli quiet. Clearly annoyed and looking to slip back inside --
What’s with you today? Huh? You forget your chores, I can see you giving me lip -- Hal looks at Eli. Regards him. Motions him over.

You know if I’m hard on you, it's cause the world’s hard. I’ve seen that. (beat) And a good man? Accounts for himself. He shoulders responsibility, even when he doesn’t want to. Eli nods, but it’s to get Hal off his back. Hal holds on a moment. Shifts. Preoccupied with something unsaid...
We need a third place for dinner. (beat) Your brother's on his way.  Hal HOLDS on Eli. Says this next part with significance.
Be careful around him.

Sizzling frying pans and simmering pots fog the air as Ha COOKS. Eli removes a new plate and utensils from a cupboa The DOORBELL RINGS. Eli turns to Hal, who nods. Get it. E goes. Opens the front door to get our first look at -- JIMMY HROBSKY (20s), white, handsome with a dash of scumb Stands on the stoop, lean, tattooed and cool with a bag s over his shoulder. Jimmy bears a familial resemblance to Hal -- genetic only
Eli.
Hey.

Man. Six years didn’t seem like such a long time until just now -- Jimmy brushes past. Rustles Eli’s hair as he goes -- Eli wincing. Jimmy enters the living room, looks around as th sizing it up, and slows. Then. Jimmy sees, crosses toward Hal in the kitchen.
Pops. Hal looks up, eyes his son standing in the doorway. Wary
This is just for a week or two.
I know. An unspoken sentiment hangs thick between these two. Hal cautiously nods.
Eli can set you up in the office.  10.
Office?
Upstairs.
ANGLE: a completely empty bedroom with a desk in it. Barr Jimmy shakes his head. Tosses his bag onto a dusty futon turns to Eli. Looks him over.
So. What's your deal these days? Eli shrugs. Beat. Jimmy does the gesture right back.
That? That’s your deal? You remember me at all?
A little.
How old were you when I left?
Which time? Jimmy snickers. Looks Eli over and grins. A mischievous g flashing. Jimmy then pushes past Eli into --
Let’s see what you did, huh? To my digs. ELI'S ROOM. Enters without permission. Jimmy scans walls space charts, original artwork and drawings, sketches of other planets and maps... huh...

Wow, okay... .-». he turns to Eli’s CLOSET. Eli watches, cautious, as spots a set of NOTCHES. HEIGHT MARKS with corresponding D scribbled to measure the growth of a child. Written atop ELI. Jimmy turns to a second set of NOTCHES on the opposite fr  11. JIMMY. He regards them a moment, looks down -- then --
What the hell are those? He’s pointing at Eli's sneakers on the floor.
My shoes.
You wear those in public?
I’m saving up for new ones.
With what? Dad’s five-dollar-a-week- allowance? Jimmy slows. Notes the way Eli stays quiet --
Oh. You got a side thing going. Little lemonade stand? (then) Good for you. I can respect that. Jimmy throws an honor-among-thieves smile at Eli. Eli nods.
Tell you what. I got some Chucks somewhere around here in a trunk. You can have em. They’re almost new. Won't stink as much as those do. (then) Sound good? There’s an outlaw charm to Jimmy.

Jimmy, cleaned up -- takes in the space of the living roo Catholic and Polish decor. Sayings in the latter. Jimmy turns, eyes a full roster of RED WINGS BOBBLE HEADS a dusty shelf. Narrows in on an YZERMAN and BOB PROBERT. Hal crosses out of the kitchen nearby. Bringing SERVING DISHES to the table. Corn, baked potatoes and Golabki --  Hal looks Hal turns the shelf a YOUNGER 12.
(points) Still got the bobble-heads, huh? up, regards the shelf a moment...
Your mother liked em. So. back into the kitchen. Leaving Jimmy to consider a moment longer. Just past them -- is a PICTURE of HAL with his arms around JIMMY’S MOTHER.
Eating in silence. Routine for Hal and Eli, but -- Jimmy from his bowl -- slows -- revels in the moment.

Golabki. You guys got no idea, man. None. Don't even get me started. (to Eli) Think you could ever miss the taste of a baked potato? And I mean. Not special. Just made right, like this, with a little butter. (then) You get locked away you got no idea the kinda shit you’1ll miss. If somebody gave me a blue light right now and some ice cream, there'd be a high probability of me breaking into tears like a little bit- Jimmy sees Hal’s expression and stops just shy. Eli grins Hal nods,
Glad you like.
I do. So, uh. How's business?
Fine. sips. Jimmy waits for him to elaborate. Doesn't happen. So Jimmy nods. Chews. Looks to Eli. Who’s watching both of them, eating. Beat.
You talk too much. Anyone ever tell you that? Huh? Eli grins again. Hal watches the way Eli sparks to that -
-- those are new. On your hands. Hal motions. Stern. To a pair of Jimmy’s small prison tat
Yeah? Like em? (taps each) This one wards off evil spirits, and this one wards off Mexicans. Eli abruptly SNORTS into his stew.
You think that’s funny?
Eli does.
He’s twelve. Hal turns his gaze on Eli. Face buried in his meal.
Sorry. It’s not. Look -- (exhales ) I'm happy to be home, okay? I just wanna talk and laugh and catch up like a family. I don’t mean anyt-
This isn't a reunion.
I know --
You were just released. You’re here cause you gotta sort your life out.
And I’m gonna --
So you wanna talk, let's talk about that. What’re your next steps?  14.
I'll get a job.
Where? What kinda job? Jimmy wavers. On the spot. Eli looks from Hal to Jimmy, t back to Hal...
To be honest? I was thinking that, with coming back, putting in some time for -- (here goes) Us to bond, show you I'm straight -- Maybe you could put in a good word at whatever site you're working.
I can’t do that.
Why not?
Cause I can't clear an ex-con. It doesn’t work like that.

But I'm your son -- I mean, you just tell em -- Hal sends a look at Jimmy. This isn’t gonna be discussed. Jimmy wavers. Hal stares right back. Beat. So Jimmy grabs fork. Fishing through his meal. STABBING carrots --
Great. So. Six years gone, no word, no visit --
I visited.
Once. To let me know ma passed. Six years! I come home, no complaints, ask for one favor and it turns out you'd rather see me flipping burgers --
It’s a start.  15.
Flipping burgers?!
Anything's better than being a thief. A low life. Jimmy halts. That stung. Looks at Hal, staring back.

I think I'm gonna step out. Got a few people to see. Jimmy slides his chair back LOUD, brings his plate to the sink. Grabs his coat, a spare key, and he's gone. Eli, he still low, waits a moment... looks to Hal...
(growls) Chores. Then bed.

WESTLAND. Just shy of Canton. Called wasteland by locals a reason. A downriver sprawl transformed by River Rouge p runoff into a hick meth paradise. A CAB pulls past us -- Jimmy gets out -- crosses the street. A group of TEENAGER across the street is going at it -- a BRAWL on a LAWN -- Two dead-eyed CONS lean off a stoop ahead. Tattoos depict valknots and the numbers 14 and 88. The SCARIER one eyes Jimmy’s approach --
What you looking for, man?
Just finished a bid out in Jackson. Uh. Taylor's expecting me to come through... he here?

A SHIT HOLE topped off with a brand new PS4 and FLAT-SCRE Cigarette-burned furniture everywhere. JUNKIES loiter lik zombies. Filthy. Swimming in drug paraphernalia. Cheery M plays loudly. Jimmy's led by a YOUNG GRUBBY WOMAN. Either sleep-deprive high -- through a gross KITCHEN, passing YOUNG TEENS coun CASH out on a folding table. To a STAIRWELL --  16.

Jimmy, doing his best calm walk, descends into an unfinis cement dungeon. Oddly packed with SHIPPING CRATES and -- -- prying each one open with a crowbar is TAYLOR BOLEK (3 a grimy Aryan con with a leaning gate and cleft lip.
(smiles) Hrobsky! Welcome home, man -- you remember my brother Dutch? Jimmy nods to DUTCH (30s), seated atop a crate nearby -- bigger, Cro-Magnon version of Taylor. Staring murder.
Yeah. How’s it goin, I uh -- Jimmy's spotted this basement's THIRD OCCUPANT. A SHIRTLE GUY, beat to shit -- FACING the corner, bleeding from his ear.
Oh that’s Renny. Don't worry about him, he's in time-out. The guy wobbles. The recipient of a very recent beating -
Tay man, come on --
Hey! What'd I tell you??
-- my ear's bleeding, man...

PUT YOUR NOSE back in that corner right fuckin now, you hear me?? Contemplate your shitty attitude. Jimmy watches this exchange -- looks again to DUTCH -- wh GLARING at Jimmy. Taylor turns back to the shipping crate

So Jimmy. You wanna toast a spliff or get right to it? Taylor RIPS the top of the crate off -- pulls a MACHINE G out into open view. This crate is FULL of them. Isreali-m Jimmy chokes out a tense smile --  17.
Not quite time to toast yet for me - - I know, I uh. I owe you guys money, which -- I'm taking real serious... The temperature of the room seems to drop a few degrees.
So you don’t got the sixty?
No, but -- I want you to see, I’m not dodging you guys --
Man. That's a real bummer. Taylor begins loading machine guns into smaller boxes lab SALSA -- where Dutch looks ready to take Jimmy’s head off

See, Jimmy -- me and my brother -- (lots and lots of guns) We don’t, ah. Project illusions about who we are and what we do, you know? We made it clear from day one, post charges or what have you, how we operate on loans, cause there are guys who do business like you, and guys who do business like us -- (turns ) Jail can be a nasty place. You needed protection out in Jackson and we were there for you. Taylor slows. Takes a mag. Fishes for a box of rounds, st loading it. Smiling away.
There some funny language about that you didn't understand? Some kinda fine print problem? CLICK-CLACK. The MACHINE GUN in Taylor's hands is loaded He takes a step in toward Jimmy --
N. No man -- that, that’s --
We know you got that father, a colored little brother...  18.
(postures ) We could go collect from them? Jimmy's scrambling. FAST for a lifeboat here and --
-- Taylor. Man. (-- folds) I said I didn't have it here -- not that I don't have it. Taylor holds. Stays put. Right in Jimmy’s face. Smiling..
We're in what we can best make out at first as a dark spa LIGHTS, unearthly, glow in abstract -- HUMMING. Brighter. This glow gathers, PULSING upward along CONCRETE WALLS --
ANGLE: Eli wakes up. Lying in bed. The HUMMING still ring lightly in his ears... After a moment -- he sits up, unable to shake the dream..

Eli PEDALS. A DUFFLE BAG slung over his shoulders. ADRENA spiking. A kid who shouldn’t be out in a neighborhood thi tough this late. Scary -- A TRIO of HOODS CALL OUT from a GAS STATION as he passes, faces lit only by the cherries of dragged cigarettes --
Yo -- 1il man! Hey! Come here real quick -- Yo!

Eli skids to a stop. No one’s visible in sight. Street li don't work out here. VACANT STRUCTURES linger now like cr monsters dozing in hunkered down silence. Haunting. The MASSIVE ABANDONED COMPLEX is right where we left it.  19.
Eli enters. Moving through the MASSIVE SPACE. Every step in the black. Eli wades further --

ANGLE: HAL'S MAGLIGHT. Right where it was dropped. Eli pi it up. CLICKS it on and TURNS, SCANS the open air and -- The aftermath of what we witnessed earlier is 100% GONE. No ice formations. No strange, FALLEN ARMORED ALIEN SOLDI Like no one was ever here. Eli WHIRLS. Aims his flashligh the walls, the ceiling, the floor -- SCORCH MARKS and HOL left by the WEAPONS’ FIRE remain, but if we're being hone A naysayer could call those anything. Eli turns to THE OPEN ELEVATOR SHAFT. Where THE WEAPON we SLIDING... he crosses -- leans over the edge -- Three stories straight down into shadow. Eli wavers... GR his DUFFLE. CLIMBS down and in. SCALING.

Eli DROPS to a safe landing, into decades of dust and deb Pitch black. Eli fumbles. CLICKS on the MAGLIGHT. Lightin the bottom of this space around him -- SEES THE WEAPON DEVICE. Still down here. Lying in the dir Eli reaches for it -- but before he can touch it, LIGHTS illuminate across the DEVICE. Eli recoils, startled for a second, then -- slowly -- he reaches... picks it up. Once again, it CHIMES. As though this thing has recognize him -- THE WEAPON COMES TO LIFE. Lighting up the darkness down here with an OTHERWORLDLY G THE OUTER SHIELD OPENS. RECONFIGURING. PIECES of its EXTERIOR RETRACT AND FOLD BA on their own to REVEAL a TRIGGER, BARREL -- a 3D TARGETTI system flickers into view, glowing, summoned out of thin Impossibly cool. The weapon HUMMING. Talking to him. Eli takes in the sight of what’s now held in his hands...  20.
ANGLE: that DUFFLE BAG NOW FULL. Slung over Eli's shoulde as he PEDALS. THE WEAPON inside.

Eli comes RACING up the street. SWERVES for cover behind bushes as -- a CAB pulls up to Hal's house ahead -- Jimmy. Eli watches Jimmy get out, his footsteps a tipsy march. Climbing the front stairs of the house...
Jimmy enters. Sees HAL. Still up watching Red Wings highlights. Beat.
Where'd you go?

Ended up at the Polish Sea League, um. Knew the bartender from ham high, she -- (drunk, smiles) Bought me some celebratory shots. Another beat. Jimmy's fumbling a little with the sleeves his coat. Hal, watches this -- and --
You need anything? Jimmy slows. Hal’s looked up from the TV at him. Jimmy’s unprepared for the civility. Cautious.
Erm. Water? Tylenol?

THE FOLLOWING IS ALL ONE SHOT: Eli silently walks his bik the driveway, DUCKS as Hal crosses past in the window abo -- holds. Eli stashes the bike and crosses, climbs a near garden stoop. Up along the back of the house. Up. Up. Up. reaches, grips the gutter above -- AND FREEZES. As Hal re-emerges in view. Slows to a STOP i the window above the sink. Goes. Once he’s gone, Eli look  21. Scales the rest of the way up to his bedroom window --
Hal returns to Jimmy with the glass of water, offers it a with two tablets of store brand ibuprofen. Jimmy accepts.
Gonna need, uh -- He fumbles. Smiles again. Stuffs the pills into his pocke
-- these bad boys in the morning. And Hal watches his own son. Drunk. Making hangover jokes something stirs deep down. Just trying to put it right.

Jimmy. I wanna help you, okay? I do. But you got a decade’s worth of bad decisions under your belt, and you gotta make up for that first. You gotta be ready to work jobs you don’t like, earn experience, earn trust -- Jimmy nods. Bleary. Pounding the glass of water. Hal eyes this -- maybe now’s not the time.
But, uh. Let’s talk in the morning. Hal nods, moves for the stairs. And as he goes --
No. We should talk now. Hal slows. Something was different in Jimmy's voice right there -- he turns back...
Eli slides the DUFFLE BAG with THE WEAPON under his bed - rises. Hearing VOICES in the living room below...
Jimmy thumbs that empty water glass a moment -- shaky... he looks back at Hal. For the first time in a while. Jimm eyes are glassy. With more than booze.  22.
Sixty K. I need to borrow sixty K. Sorry but it’s gotta be you. Jimmy's eyes are glassy with fear. Hal’s unsure how to re
From me? Are you kidding? Jimmy I don’t have that kind of --
It’s a whole thing. It's the reason I'm alive right now. You gotta hear me out —-
-- no. I don't. Hal’s interrupted Jimmy. He holds on his son.
Not in my own home. Whatever this is, I’m not interested. Not anymore. Hal turns again. Moves determined up the stairs now --
What about the safe? (beat) The one you keep at work sites. -- and Hal STOPS.
One time, cash goes missing. I'll never ask you for a thing again, I can even pay it back over time -- Hal MOVES decisively back down the stairs --
What exactly are you saying to me? You want me to do what, exactly? (approaching) Steal for you? Let you steal?
It’s not for me, that’s what I’m-
Who's it for then? Huh? Let’s hear. Go ahead --  23.

Dangerous people. Okay? For when I was inside. (imploring) The kind you don't not pay back. People who won't just stop with me, you -- you -- (dire) Understand what I'm saying to you? I’m trying to protect you guys here! UPSTAIRS - CONTINUOUS: Eli, now back in his pajamas, quie approaches the top of the STAIRCASE -- there’s silence, t
Get the hell out. Now. DOWNSTAIRS - CONTINUOUS: Hal’s anger now barely controlle jabs his finger at the door. Jimmy, plea still ringing in eyes, examines this -- and turns. Sets down the water gla
It’s funny. Cause I came in here -- marvelling at this place like the house time forgot, but you made changes, didn’t you? He grabs his jacket, moves for the door and slows. Motion

(fumbles with his coat) I don’t see myself in any a these pictures -- not a one. My room? It’s gone. You’ve got your replacement son up there in my bed. UPSTAIRS - CONTINUOUS: Eli, hearing Jimmy refer to him li this, blinks -- and pauses. Those words hurt.
You erased every trace’a me. Didn't you? That how proud I make you? Would Mom’ve wanted that?

Your mother’d be disgusted right now. Get the fuck outta my house. I’m not telling you again. DOWNSTAIRS - CONTINUOUS: Jimmy nods. Some father. SLAMS t door as he GOES. Leaves Hal to watch him trail away alone We HOLD on Hal here. His face. All of this familiar.  24.
Eli STRAINS again. Loading lumber back into Hal's truck. slams a piece into place. Visibly grumpier than usual. Hal hands Eli a piece of paper en route to closing up the garage. SLAMMING it shut.
Here. Things I need done today. Before I get home. Eli looks. It's a LIST of chores like a million miles lon
Today? Ever since Jimmy --
-- Jimmy's got nothing to do with it. I'm keeping you out of trouble. Hal climbs into his truck without another word, starts up pulls away. Eli watches him go a moment. What the hell?

IN THE HALLWAY: We HEAR THE WEAPON power to life behind E closed bedroom door. PULSATING. ANGLE: ELI in his room. Holding it up now. Its SIGHTING SYSTEM flickers into view. He grins, inspecting its conto up close... And moves to a STANDING MIRROR ahead. MUGS at his reflect with THE WEAPON. MASSIVE in his hands. Eli poses with it few times -- and grins. Begins QUICK-DRAWING with the SPA WEAPON on his own reflection. SHWIP! SWHIP! SHWIP! He stops. Beat. Listening for the sound of Hal’s truck, a
What’d you say? (DRAWS REAL FAST)
Want summa this, huh?
One of those dumps along 8 mile near Woodward. Jimmy, hun at the edge of a shoddy bed -- eyes the ibuprofin Hal gav him. Looking like death. Searching the air for options.  25.
The place is spotless. Eli’s watching TV when Hal ENTERS CROSSES and DROPS an arm-load of SCRAP METAL onto the CAR Eli JOLTS --

My maglight mysteriously reappears right where it's supposed to be -- and I'm not gonna get curious? Took me all of five seconds to find that stash behind the garage. Explain. Eli’s trapped. Locks up -- debates denying it until he se the look on Hal’s face -- thinks better of it.
... there’s a couple scrap yards that pay money for --
-- scrapping? You're scrapping? Where did all this come from?
A place off Grand River.

Tay -- look. Taylor takes the phone. Looks at it. ON SCREEN -- a link NEWSCAST has been e-mailed to Snick.

Aud's canvassing all the news shit back home -- Taylor WATCHES the link. Able to see the headline: Fleein suspects caught. In Nevada. The IMAGE of Jimmy in the back of that SQUAD CAR plays.  Taylor pauses the video. Eyeing the INSIGNIA on the the CRUISER Jimmy's inside...
How far away are we from -- (squints, beat) -- Blue Falls, Nevada?

door of Morgan's crown vic ROARING en route for the state line. Pushing it. On the seat next to her -- Morgan's phone CHI A TEXT has come in. Careful with the wheel, Morgan reache -- checks it. The EVIDENCE PHOTO of THE WEAPON we just sa taken pops into view. Morgan holds on her first look. Takes in this thing’s contours. With the protective shield on, it’s hard to place exactly what it is -- the moment interrupted when HER PHONE RINGS. She accepts the call.
Scary looking thing isn't it?
What is it?
Apparently that’s our mystery weapon. Morgan looks once more to the image --

Told you. This one wasn’t right. (considers ) Tell them not to touch this thing and that the suspects go nowhere -- nowhere until I arrive. And let that tactical unit out of St. George know I’1l definitely be needing them. Just in case...
They started hitting him, so --
Eli sits in a chair flanking an OFFICER'S DESK. This stat spacious, well lived in.  100.
I ran and I yelled for them to stop, but they picked me up -- The YOUNG OFFICER (30s) seated at the desk takes notes.
This was when you went to the truck to retrieve the -- item? Eli nods, the Officer scribbles. Eli looks. From where he seated, he can see HOLDING TANKS up a short hallway ahead

Jimmy sits alone on a concrete slab in this claustrophobi space. Looks up as a folding chair is set down on the oth side of bars. Eli emerges, sits... .»+. his jaw still clenched tight. Jimmy looks him over.
Are they treating you okay?
Yeah.
They haven't charged you with anything have they? Cause they don’t got anything they can -- Eli looks down. Jimmy slows.

Jimmy, they only gave me ten minutes with you. Jimmy doesn't respond. Wearing the guilt. He rises, idle, moves to the back wall... eases his fists into place against it a moment -- at the very bottom now. Nothing is said. Jimmy wavers there, fists balled. Eyes ringing. Stooped like a battered prizefighter out of roun
I didn't kill him, alright? When Jimmy turns to face Eli, desperation is flashing.  101.

You can think whatever you want’a me, but it didn’t happen like how they're saying on TV. Dad walked in on me and -- some dangerous guys raiding his safe for the money. That part’s true cause it’s money I owed em or I was dead -- we all were. Water builds in Jimmy's expression. Rallying bravado --

And I told him. I pleaded with him, to turn around and walk away -- and he had to stand there and be fuckin righteous as usual -- -- but the truth is clear. As clear as day in his eyes. Desperately fighting its swell. Anger and HURT lashing ou

He had to make some point to god- knows-who and get himself shot. He wouldn’t just let it go -- he had to -- (goes quiet, then) I’m not a good guy, Eli... but I... Eli, sits there, soul stirring -- staring back, defiant.
If he was hard on us -- it’s cause the world is hard. Jimmy knows where those words came from. Who they came fr
And a good man is -- he’s -- he accounts for himself. (beat) Is responsible. Even when he doesn’t wanna be. Eli holds. Shakes his head. Rises. Leaves Jimmy in silenc
Eli. Eli, wait --

Eli exits away from the sound of Jimmy’s voice. Back to w he was seated, his head lowered out of view --  102. -- and as he does, we hear that familiar HUMMING. The HUM OF THE WEAPON, getting louder and louder in his head...

An AGING BLUE COLLAR DRIVER in a WAGONEER pulls up to a r light. Waits. For a long moment, there’s no one in sight -- until our Blue Collar Driver spots a PAIR OF HEADLIGHT approach through the rear view. As they near -- We can make out that this isn’t a vehicle. It’s THE CLEAN Their ENGINES slowing into DULL GROWLS as they pull up -- -- both parties now waiting on the red. The Driver, after moment, looks over at the motor cyclists -- and sees THEI HELMETS. Then. The FUTURISTIC SIDEARM holstered on the closest rider’s LEG -- -- and he stops. Looks up to see that he’s been spotted. of THE CLEANERS are now STARING right back. The closest reaches, covers the FUTURISTIC GUN with his COAT -- And on this cue, both BIKES REV THEIR ENGINES. RIPPING aw just as the light TURNS GREEN -- leaving the BLUE COLLAR DRIVER in thier wake to ponder what the hell he just saw.

AND WE FOLLOW the two CLEANERS on the OPEN FREEWAY. WEAVI and DODGING through TRAFFIC at unprecedented speed. INSANE. MOTORISTS are being passed with such frequency th might as well be standing still -- ENGINES GUNNING LOUDER
VARIOUS: The lights of the station dimmed now. Eli sleeps a small sofa in the Sheriff's OFFICE. Everything quiet.
OFFICERS linger. Still on duty in the dead of night. TWO the bullpen. Two kick back in the kitchen. Another works rustic DISPATCH ROOM -- lastly:
The CLERK mans his post up front. CLICKS away on facebook  103. -- until he spots HEADLIGHTS PULLING INTO the lot through dirty glass doors of the STATION'S MAIN ENTRANCE ahead.
(calls out) Our friend from Denver just showed -- He yawns. Goes back to his comp as the outline of Morgan approaches from the lot outside. She enters --
Scuse me. The Clerk looks at the sound of a male’s voice. TAYLOR BO
Help you?
I'm looking for a caucasian degenerate featured on the news earlier. Got a little black fella with him. The Clerk Officer taking in the sight of this guy --
And who're you?
They here? Another beat. The Clerk matches Taylor’s intimidation pla Dead-pan stares him.
I couldn't give out that info even if they were.

Gotcha. Taylor draws the pistol concealed at his waist and -- AROUND THE STATION: OFFICERS freeze at the CLAP of GUNFIR The icy realization of what that was up close and near -- IN THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE: Eli blinks out of his nap -- JIMMY also heard that -- BACK WITH TAYLOR: He moves -- SWINGS open the main entran with his boot. Waving SNICK and the REST OF HIS CREW in.  104.
Yeah -- they’re here. They ENTER, and hold a beat to begin divvying ear protect DISPATCH ROOM: Taylor BLASTS the lock and handle off. The OFFICER on DISPATCH already RADIOING for HELP --
-- shots fired inside the station -- shots fired INSIDE -- BLAM. Taylor BLASTS him off his chair as -- BEYOND: The TWO OFFICERS emerge from the mess room and ai

text: can hear BRUTAL GUNFIRE ERUPT up and down the MAIN CORRID beyond. The sound of it RAGING up the HALLWAY across the other side of the BULLPEN -- fear rising up -- Eli moves toward the office door to get a better look and SLAM. It FLINGS open and Eli is GRABBED -- by the YOUNG OFFICER he gave his statement to earlier.
What's happening --
Get behind that desk now -- (pushing Eli back) -- down. Stay here, DO NOT MOVE -- -- The Young Officer turns. PISTOL out. Showing fear. Sha The RATTLING of MORE GUNFIRE EXPLODING --

But who's -- SLAM. The YOUNG OFFICER leaves again. Eli watches through office windows as he joins the other BULLPEN COP -- MOVIN away out of sight. TOWARD the FIREFIGHT. WITH JIMMY IN THE TANK: Jimmy's trying to see out into th BULLPEN beyond. From where he is, he’s only got partial v

HEY! What's going on!? WITH ELI IN THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE: No one’s able to see wh happening. WE HOLD with Eli through the sounds of GUNFIRE it RETURNS. Louder and Louder. BRBRBRBRBRAKAKAKAK -- Eli's petrified -- watching -- now MUZZLE FLASHES CRACKLE  105. -- nearer. And NEARER. And FINALLY -- The YOUNG OFFICER STAGGERS back into view. Having been HI across his LEFT SIDE -- barely DODGING an ARC OF GUNFIRE it WEAVES past, chasing him into view. A clumsy dodge tha leaves him CLAMORING on the floor. Eli, wide-eyed, watches the YOUNG OFFICER begin SCRAMBLIN Eli’s direction -- SLAM. He COLLAPSES into the room. Colo draining as blood flows freely --
(whispering) Get -- g-get back behind the desk -- I’1l hold them -- But this guy's not protecting anyone. Eli looks -- franti for options. And he --

My bag -- where is it? The Young Officer holds. Knows what Eli’s asking for. BRBRBAKAKAKAK -- sounding out from nearby. Closest yet. The YOUNG OFFICER acquiesces. Fateful. Motions. Fumbling his keys --

(re: specific key) Through the service door -- back of the station. Ev -- evidence lockup. THE BULLPEN - MOMENTS LATER: Eli exits the SHERIFF’S OFFI and stays low en route to a SERVICE DOOR just as -- Taylor -- with blood trickling down the side of his face a head wound, a bullet graze maybe -- emerges into view. Searching. Snick and remaining members of his crew, some them WOUNDED -- are right behind Taylor. BACK CORRIDOR: Eli SCRAMBLES through the innards of the STATION. Hard copy FILE ROOMS -- IN THE BULLPEN: the sheriff's office door is KICKED IN. T YOUNG OFFICER dragged out by SNICK -- into the bullpen --

Got a last man standing -- IN HOLDING: From his cell, Jimmy can see faint slivers of YOUNG OFFICER. Mumbling plea after plea --  106. Jimmy sees TAYLOR. Here. Twenty feet away -- oh no no no The YOUNG OFFICER is YANKED up to his knees. Jimmy watchi as Taylor crosses over --

Sorry. Witnesses are a no can do. BLAM -- Taylor GUNS down the YOUNG OFFICER. Jimmy RECOILS in horror. Crabbing backwards. Color draini from his face. Frozen as he slows. Quiet. Then. HEARS footsteps. WHISTLING. A rendition of a familiar tun Joni Mitchell's HELP ME. And it's nearing. Louder... Until Taylor limps slowly into view on the other side of bars. Sees Jimmy backed into the rear of his cell. Smiles Jimmy doesn't say a word -- stays where he is...
Been lookin for you, Hrobsky. Taylor saddles up close to the bars. Watching Jimmy. Cage here... Taylor chews. Aims the shotgun in his hands throu the bars. Taylor smiles...
(to his guys) Somebody grab me a set’a keys!

At this moment, Morgan's arriving out front. PULLING INTO station’s lot. Followed by an SUV, reading ST. GEORGE PD Morgan eases into an IDLE, sees -- through the windshield The IMPOSING VAN parked strangely in the lot ahead.

ON JIMMY: DRAGGED now. Right into the center of the BULLP DROPPED to the ground -- right next to the body of the YO OFFICER. YANKED upward to his knees. Taylor eases the barrel of his SHOTGUN right into Jimmy's chin. Smiles.
Your little brother around? (smiles)  107.
I’m gonna do something to you I want him to see...

Morgan's out of her car now. Something's clearly not righ She looks to other OFFICERS with her -- the St. George TA SQUAD, getting out of the van nearby, when -- HIGH CALIBER ASSAULT RIFLE FIRE hoses down the lot. Morga and TAC SQUAD under fire from one of TAYLOR'S CREW inside
The GUNFIRE is heard from in here as well. The VOICE of o of Taylor's men calls out from beyond --
Company!! More COPS!! Taylor digs the barrel into Jimmy’s neck. Jimmy making hi peace in silence -- Taylor nods. Moves to pull back on th trigger, and --

Tell Dutch I say hi -- -- we hear THE WEAPON being POWERED UP. Taylor looks -- to see Eli. Having re-entered. Taylor tak in the shape and form of THE WEAPON in Eli’s hands, point right at him -- perplexed --
The hell is that thin-

Taylor EXPLODES. Literally. BLASTED out of existence befo his gun can go off -- into a blinding flash of ENERGY and viscera -- SNICK DRAWS on Eli -- JIMMY LUNGES. CLAMORS for SNICK'S GUN -- The SHOT SNICK FIRES goes SIDEWAYS. SNICK FLINGS JIMMY AWAY -- Turns to fire directly at Jimmy as he falls -- BLAAAAAAAM Eli BLOWS Snick AWAY before he can shoot. Snick’s ashy remains rain down. TWO OF TAYLOR'S MEN REMAIN IN THE ROOM  108. One's FIRING at JIMMY as he MAD DASHES on his hands and knees. The OTHER DROPS for cover behind a nearby desk -- WHIRLING, MACHINE GUN in hand to -- BRBRBRAKAKAKAK -- FIRES at ELI -- who recoils. Looks. Idea. Eli AIMS at the DESK the guy is HIDING BEHIND and -- BLAAAAAAAM. Eli BLOWS it straight to hell -- SENDS the GU behind it SAILING BACKWARD and AIRBORNE amidst tufts of printer paper -- THROUGH a nearby WALL into the next room BRBRBRBRBRBAKAKAKAKAKAAKAK -- The guy who was shooting at Jimmy WHIRLS on Eli, buckling in the weight of the moment going RAMBO with his AMMO -- Eli hunkers down -- aims UPWARD and BLLAAAAAMM -- FIRES O Rambo's head INTO THE CEILING -- CINDERBLOCK AND FOUNDATION EXPLODE AND RAIN DOWN on the g
Morgan WHIRLS as Eli's BLAST THROUGH THE CEILING sends CH of the STATION'S ROOF SPEWING SKYWARD like a geyser -- What. The. Fuck. Was. That.
Tell me we've got backup coming --
ETA's two/three minutes --

Eli, with the silence having spread -- chances a glance - -- A HAND REACHES. GRABS HIM -- YANKS him down behind cov of a short cubicle WALL -- It's Jimmy. Who's pulled Eli into cover just as -- the GU who was covering the front entrance -- APPEARS at the END
-- what looks like an AR-15 -- BRBRBRRBKAKAKAKAKAKAKAAK - Both of them cover. Scared. As lead BURNS PAST. Jimmy tak stock of what Eli just did to save him...
You okay?  109. Eli manages a nod. Brave.
Are you? Jimmy... motions to the GUNMAN. Still a ways up that hall
I can. Uh. Give you some cover -- Eli nods again, and Jimmy drops low, scurries left. LEANS

Hey! Yo! FIRE RETURNS on Jimmy, giving Eli the chance to drop RIGH BLLAAAAAAAAM! Eli sends a BLAST down the corridor -- it EXPLODES into CHUNKY DEBRIS, but RETURN FIRE sounds back second later -- he’s still up there -- well covered -- Eli tries again -- BLLAAAAAAAAM! Still no good --
I’m trying -- BRBRBRBAKAKAKAKAKAKK -- automatic FIRE POUNDS PAST overhe Eli and Jimmy COVER -- BRBRBRBRKAKAKAKAK --

He’s yours man -- take him out -- Then. Eli remembers The GREEN NODE. Lower left side of th barrel. Eli jostles the WEAPON, finds it -- KR-SHRRR-VRRRP. The WEAPON JOLTS in his hands and two sle appendages extend sideways like recoil dampeners once aga

Come on -- Eli, rallying -- RISES fast into view as down the hall, t LAST OF TAYLOR‘S GUNMEN SWINGS INTO VIEW -- AIMS -- Eli FIRES FIRST. Pulls the TRIGGER and THE WEAPON EXPLODE with BLUE LIGHT. AMASSING in a SURGE before --

EXPLODING forward in a tidal wave of BLUE ENERGY. Eli’s THROWN BACKWARD by the recoil as --  110. The ENTIRE HALLWAY around the remaining shooter IGNITES. BLASTING A HOLE STRAIGHT THROUGH the SIDE OF THE STATION beyond -- -- and silence. Jimmy turns. Pulls Eli to his feet. They exchange glances --
Have I seen that one yet? That was new, right?? Shit, Eli -- Eli, with the wind knocked out of him a little, nods. The entire station now beyond them QUIET. Taylor & Co. gone..
Keep low, alright? I’1l -- (looks up, around) -- go first I guess, just -- (re: the weapon) -- there could be more of em. Keep that thing handy -- maybe stick with the first mode, yeah?

Okay -- Eli taps the node until the WEAPON RETURNS to normal. Jim looks around again. The coast still clear, so. Jimmy move cautious, motions Eli along -- Making for the scorched hallway. Darkened now -- overhead lighting flickering inconsistently -- Eli sticks close at Jimmy's side, THE WEAPON ready -- the moment building -- forward --

BACKUP HAS ARRIVED. LOCAL PD now SWARMING into position around the station. OVER A DOZEN SQUAD CARS. Jumping in alongside Morgan and the TAC SQUAD. Armed and ready. So many POLICE the building is surrounded on ALL SIDES --

Jimmy and Eli move in close formation through the afterma of Taylor's gunfight. We see both fallen cops AND members Taylor's crew. Motionless... Closing in on the FINAL TURN. We see dust and ash flutter through the air. The LOBBY and MAIN ENTRANCE just beyond  111.

Jimmy chances a glance into the lobby now. And sees it. B and red lights. Flashing in through every window. Jimmy curses. Inches forward, low -- peaks a look out to see -- A PARKING LOT FILLED WITH COPS.

Ah man -- Jimmy turns. Sinks down along the wall. Face wracked. No clean exit. Beat. He looks to Eli. Face long -- OUTSIDE: and Jimmy can see them GEARING UP out there. Rea Morgan can be seen coordinating. Doling out ORDERS.
Looks like we’ll have more company pretty shortly...
What’re they gonna do? A long silence follows. Jimmy's expression far off and aw Then. He looks back at Eli and smiles, sad.
They're probably gonna come in here and take us away. Could be the last time we see each other for awhile -- Beat. Jimmy looks at Eli.

-- I'll go away for good. You'll be alone again. I’m sorry, I -- it was never meant to be like this. Dad was right. Be more like him, okay? (then) Less like me. Eli looks up at Jimmy. Quiet. And there we have it. Jimmy nods. Sober. Lays the pistol down. Like releasing s great weight. Slides it away. Looks at Eli. Silence linge

You and me’1l always be brothers. Like it or not. And I'll always be there for you. Best as I can. Okay?  112. Jimmy strains. Gets to his knees, puts his hands atop his head -- ready to be arrested. Eli sets down THE WEAPON nearby... gets on his knees...
They like it when you link your fingers. Just like this. (then) They'll be everywhere real soon. I want you to do everything they tell you, okay? Eli copies. Scared. Holding back tears.
Elijah. You’1l be fine. AND WE HOLD: on two brothers. Side by side. Listening to sound of BOOTS like a gathering storm outside --
Officers RACE up. From EVERY SIDE. GUNS DRAWN, SWARMING - and that’s when we hear it. STREET BIKES. In BREAKNECK approach. Coming right this wa Morgan, amidst the STORMING POLICE, turns --

Ma’ am? OTHER POLICE look as well. Taking in the TWO HEADLIGHTS a they come SAILING IN. WAY TOO FAST AND -- It's THE CLEANERS. They DRAW WEAPONS. ONE PULLS and aims looks like a HANDGUN version of Eli’s WEAPON, FIRES -- BLASTING straight through BARRICADES. POLICE go LEAPING A BULLETS BOUNCE OFF their ADVANCED ARMOR -- IGNORING incom fire. Heading right for THE STATION --
Jimmy hears this -- looks -- Eli too --
Morgan CHARGES. YELLS to POLICE --  113.

GO!! Hit the DOOR! Don’t let them past you into the STATION! Morgan and POLICE RUSH THE DOOR as OFFICERS BEHIND them attempt to SLOW the BIKES -- The SWAT BATTERING RAM SWINGS. FOOOSH. The SECOND CLEANER FIRES SOMETHING past Morgan. I the POLICE STATION'S MAIN WINDOW. A CANNISTER or --
Eli and Jimmy watch as THE DOOR BUCKLES under the WEIGHT
-- as the GRENADE-SHAPED INCENDIARY ricochettes off the w beside Eli and --

The PROJECTILE EXPLODES. Jimmy is HURLED straight backward by the BLAST -- The POL rushing in VANISH in BLINDING LIGHT -- As Eli’s form is CONSUMED BY SHOCKWAVE -- he cries out -- And halts. Nothing happens. Beat. His eyes still closed. Eli opens t Chances a look around.

Not dead. The explosion didn't even scratch Eli. He turns FAST -- to JIMMY -- and goes wide eyed. Jimmy's just a few feet away. But he’s suspended in mid-a The gravity that should be tethering him to the floor gon As though the blast has hurled Jimmy backward in super sl motion -- Eli turns. The same can be said for the POLICE who just kicked the door in -- there’s Morgan -- also nearly froze Dust and debris flung by the blast hangs -- Time has frozen around Eli. He looks. Down at the explode grenade-like device at his feet. Spent. As though it's created some kind of force-field around just Eli. Eli PANICS. He turns -- fast. Grabs THE WEAPON --  114.

Hello? -- out the FRONT DOOR of the STATION. All of the POLICE OFFICERS outside FROZEN too. No one to answer -- silence For a moment, the sight of all this comes with a bewilder but very real sensation of awe -- and then -- MOVEMENT sounds behind Eli. He WHIRLS, takes FAST AIM at THE CLEANERS. Here in the station. Their WEAPONS drawn as they step int view. A standoff. Menacing -- Eli STAYS PUT -- terrified -- keeps his aim -- And here, as they approach -- we've got our best look at these two figures yet -- The FIRST CLEANER is TALLER and LEANER where the SECOND i STOCKIER with wide shoulders -- The TALLER CLEANER holds the silence. Takes stock of the small human boy in front of him. A David to Goliaths. And the FIRST CLEANER steps forward. Weapon up. Eli SWINGS the barrel of THE WEAPON at him. The TARGETING system LOCKS ON -- the weapon's power surging warning... «+. the Cleaner raises his hand in response. A gesture of calm -- wait -- we see the Taller Cleaner’s has five fingers. Reaching slowly to tap a small console his neck -- Eli watches -- AS THE TALLER CLEANER’S MECHANIZED HELMET RETRACTS. To reveal the face of a human. A man. A transparent breat apparatus wraps along his cheek into his nostrils -- aidi his breathing in our atmosphere.
It's okay, son. Hang on, let's just talk a minute, alright? Eli's blanching at the sight of what's behind that mask - maintains his grip on the weapon -- fingers CLAMPED --
Look. We’re not here to hurt you. (then)  115.
But that weapon -- we need it back. It doesn’t belong here -- Eli doesn’t waver -- gun still up. Overwhelmed, trembling Taking stock of the TALL CLEANER --
And what -- what happens to me when I give it to you?
Look at your arm, Elijah. Eli slows at the mention of his name... Eli looks. This guy's pointing at Eli's scar.

That's your activator. It’s the reason you’re able to operate that thing and no one else. (then, cautiously) Your parents made sure you got one before you left, so that some day you can return. And Eli stops.
My parents? The Cleaner sees the emotion he's gotten from this kid. T panic and the hope all at once -- A lot to take in. The Cleaner sees this, crosses closer.

Your family have enemies -- the ones who located you here, who tracked you to that warehouse where you'd been salvaging -- (beat) We reached them before they got to you, but not quick enough apparently. The Tall Cleaner extends his hand now for THE WEAPON.
Time dispersals are only temporary, and this one’s about to collapse. Sir. I’m gonna need you to hand it over now. We don't have long --  116.
(in perfect Chinese) Thirty seconds.

(also in perfect Chinese) This is important. The Tall Cleaner motions. Eli turns, sees Jimmy -- still suspended mid-air -- but we can now see the faint traces MOVEMENT accelerating -- same with Morgan and the POLICE Eli looks from the frozen forms of storming police -- dow Studies THE WEAPON in his hand -- for the last time -- ha it over. His eyes still swimming --
But I don’t understand -- am I human?
100%. And from Earth. Just not this version. The SECOND CLEANER steps forward -- takes the weapon, sna it MAGNETICALLY onto his back --
We gotta move. The Tall Cleaner nods. Eyes Eli -- he can't just leave hi with that. So the Tall Cleaner acquiesces --

We are at war, Elijah. An all too violent war that threatens more than you can imagine. And you're too important to be caught up in it right now. (beat) But just because you’re lonely, it doesn’t mean that you’re alone. You will see your parents again. They're counting on it. Then. Fateful.

And then you'll be giving us orders. The Cleaner offers his hand. A soldier's hand.  117. Eli accepts. Head-spun. Shakes it. The Tall Cleaner grins rises. Falls in with the SECOND -- -- who draws what looks like a MECHANIZED BATON -- ACTIVA it. The BATON SURGES. CRACKLING with LIGHT -- Eli RECOILS, watches -- sees his BREATH BEGIN TO FOG, the TEMPERATURE here dropping. FROST -- just like before -- GROWS in crystalline formations across every surface, the ceiling and floor -- -- slivers of tiny snow, condensation in the air freezing begin to fall -- leading Eli's gaze to JIMMY. Still flyin backwards in ultra slow-mo but now quickly ACCELERATING - The SECOND CLEANER WEAVES the baton through the air as th TRACING A DOORWAY -- the TALL CLEANER locks eyes with Eli

Be seeing you. And what can only be described as a HOLE TORN OUT OF THIN ERUPTS INTO EXISTENCE. Unreal. A doorway to another world The Cleaners step through -- the DOORWAY COLLAPSES behind them. LIKE THAT -- they’re gone. And time rights itself. Jimmy SMACKS the floor, YELPS -- POLICE BREAK IN -- from EVERY ANGLE -- immediately and overwhelming -- YELLING ORDERS. Get down -- etc, etc -- Jimmy, on the floor, hands in the air -- yells back that and Eli are UNARMED. Eli’s knocked HARD to the ground. CU PULLING BACK. From Eli’s view -- everything changed. Morgan stands in view. Takes in the insanity of this scen The frost -- the carnage --
Clear the building! MOVE! -- and Eli at the center. No Cleaners. No weapon. Gone.
Eli sits in the back of an AMBULANCE. The scene of the shootout A FLURRY of ACTIVITY now -- -- every face betraying shock. Eli watches until --  118.
I found the statement you were giving inside. Eli looks up briefly to see Morgan standing nearby.
Your brother seems to be matching it blow for blow. Morgan nods across the lot where Jimmy speaks to LOCAL CO
With the exception of a few things. Eli remains silent. Still in shock --
I'd say he’s covering for you. Morgan looks to Eli. He looks up at her. Contemplates tha
Which... I might just advise you to let him do, given you’re a minor and you've got your whole life ahead of you.
Eli slows. Digests that. Looks off to Jimmy --
What's gonna happen to my brother?
He’s gonna go away for a while. (beat) But if he keeps cooperating -- it might not be for as long as he thinks. Morgan holds. Looks at Eli a little more dire now --

As an incident on public record, you've managed to raise some eye- brows. Crazy looking weapons and men in armored suits vanishing into thin air... there are people who’re gonna want to talk to you. Eli remains quiet.  119.

But we can go over that later. For now, just sit tight -- Eli holds on this -- eyes Morgan as she rises, moves off. watches her go. And then sees -- -- Jimmy, still cuffed, is HOISTED to his feet. Lead away a detail of uniformed POLICE. Jimmy and Eli catch each other's eye. Jimmy nods. Juts hi chin as he goes. Still Jimmy. As he’s loaded into a CRUISER, Eli catches Jimmy's gaze, standing there -- ELI offers up that now-familiar all goo wink. Jimmy, across the lot -- grins WIDE, sends it back.
You don't get to choose family.
Jimmy, with his wrists still cuffed -- raises them into a little wave -- watches his little brother's figure recede into the faraway distance behind him --
You don’t. Just cause someone is, it doesn’t mean they can’t hurt you. Doesn’t mean they won't.
Eli looks -- out through the crowded lot -- just out.

All you can do when it comes to the people you love is brace yourself. Across the face of the world he can see beyond. Our world Eyes traversing its contours as though feeling for what's beyond. For who. A light wind picks up.
That's just how it is. And Eli holds... and we CUT TO BLACK.
